alert.note: Alert for Scotland; Wayne (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 30 at 10:06PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall will be possible. * WHERE...The southern Sandhills and Coastal Plain of North Carolina, including the following counties: Cumberland, Hoke, Sampson, Scotland, and Wayne. * WHEN...Through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rain from Tropical Storm Idalia will become heavy at times overnight, then gradually taper off through early Thursday, with total rainfall amounts between 3 and 7 inches. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
